news_header: Samir El Chekieh, a firefighter and paramedic, responds to the aftermath of Israeli air strikes in Lebanon, facing chaos and casualties amidst the ongoing conflict with Hezbollah.
news_text: Samir El Chekieh, a 32-year-old firefighter and paramedic with the Lebanese Civil Defense Force, drives an ambulance to the site of an Israeli air strike in El Karak, Lebanon. The ongoing conflict between Israel and Hezbollah has resulted in increased casualties among civilians, including women and children. Samir describes the devastation and chaos he encounters, including the tragic discovery of victims, including children. The article highlights the humanitarian efforts of the Civil Defense Force, which operates without discrimination across sectarian lines. As the conflict escalates, the toll on both the responders and the affected communities grows, with many families displaced and lives shattered.
